title: Foundation (School Level)
description: Focus on Physics, Mathematics, and Computer Science. Develop strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

title: Undergraduate Studies
description: Pursue a Bachelor's degree in Physics, Astronomy, Astrophysics, or Aerospace Engineering. Learn programming languages like Python and MATLAB for data analysis and simulation.

title: Advanced Education (Post-Graduation)
description: Opt for a Master's degree in Astrophysics, Space Science, or related fields. Develop expertise in research areas like celestial mechanics, cosmology, or observational astronomy.

title: Research and PhD
description: Specialize in a specific field like exoplanets, galaxy formation, or spacecraft technology. Publish research papers in scientific journals to establish expertise.

title: Practical Exposure
description: Participate in internships at space agencies, observatories, or research labs. Work on satellite design, mission simulations, or space system analysis.

title: Skill Development
description: Master coding, machine learning, and data visualization. Learn CAD and modeling software if interested in spacecraft design. Stay updated with advancements in AI and robotics for space exploration.

title: Building a Network
description: Join astronomical societies and attend conferences. Collaborate with scientists and engineers to work on interdisciplinary projects.

title: Applications and Space Missions
description: Apply to space agencies or research organizations for scientist or engineer roles. Explore positions in private companies like SpaceX, Blue Origin, or ISRO collaborators.

title: Personal Growth
description: Stay curious and keep exploring new research ideas. Develop patience and resilience to handle the challenges of long-term projects.
